body_html: Hi @ryanleary! For the initial release of ONNX, we only tested that it was able to export word_language_model (https://github.com/pytorch/examples/tree/master/word_language_model), so there are almost certainly other operations to add to the exporter to make other RNNs; we're definitely accepting patches in this area. However, word_language_model has a fixed number of layers, which means that ONNX exports it in unrolled form. A bit more design work (and ONNX standardization) would be needed before we can export more dynamic RNN structures, so I would say this is lower priority for the short term.

body: Hi @ryanleary! For the initial release of ONNX, we only tested that it was able to export word_language_model (https://github.com/pytorch/examples/tree/master/word_language_model), so there are almost certainly other operations to add to the exporter to make other RNNs; we're definitely accepting patches in this area. However, word_language_model has a fixed number of layers, which means that ONNX exports it in unrolled form. A bit more design work (and ONNX standardization) would be needed before we can export more dynamic RNN structures, so I would say this is lower priority for the short term.
